#  Record-Setting Insurance **Claim Attorneys**

Our Insurance Lawyers Level the Playing Field

Play Video

We pay premiums on insurance policies with a simple expectation: our insurance
company will offer relief when disaster strikes. Friendly slogans, charming
commercials, and slick promises have made it easy to trust our insurers. Yet,
when we need them most, insurance companies often don’t hold up their end of
the deal.

When someone is struggling to receive a fair settlement, they turn to our team
at Arnold & Itkin. **We help with insurance claims and cases involving:**

  * Car accidents
  * Fire damage claims
  * Business interruption claims
  * Water and flood damage
  * Bad faith insurance practices
  * First-party insurance claims
  * Hurricane insurance claims
  * Tornado damage claims

Our insurance claim lawyers have a reputation for taking on cases that make
headlines. When a historic storm such as Hurricane Harvey devastates coastal
America, we’re standing by to make sure people can rebuild their homes and
businesses.

When an insurance company refuses to honor a policy after a serious accident,
we help people pick up the pieces of their lives. Our track record under the
spotlight means we’re prepared for any situation that our clients might face.

Our team of insurance claim attorneys has seen every tactic insurance
companies use to unfairly delay or deny valid claims. If your claim has
stalled, we have experience getting insurers to pay fairly. We’ve stood up to
the largest insurers in the nation and have recovered more than $15 billion in
verdicts and settlements. We fight to level the playing field against large
insurance companies, no matter what.

## We Don’t Hesitate to Put in the Work

When an insurance company unfairly denies a claim, the process basically
follows a script. They’re slow to respond, provide lowball estimates, and send
clients in endless loops to frustrate them. Hiring our lawyers shows your
company that their tactics won’t be tolerated. Helping people restore their
lives after an accident or disaster is what we do, and we never settle for
less than the best for them. When an insurance company says it can’t do more,
we step in to tell them they must.

Successful insurance claim lawsuits require research, dedication, and
experience. We pour the resources into cases that are needed for success. If
adjusters aren’t being honest, we make sure to change that with our own
investigation and experts. Then, if the other side isn’t being fair after all
our work, we won’t hesitate to take them to court. For many insurance
companies, hearing “Arnold & Itkin" during a claims process means it’s time to
play fair. That’s the power of our dedication to securing results for clients.

## Contact Us Immediately for a Free Consultation

Car accidents, natural disasters, and medical emergencies are all different
situations. However, people often find themselves relying on insurance
companies to make them whole after any of them. Our team has experience with
nearly every type of claim. We’re passionate about helping clients get the
compensation they’re entitled to because we know how daunting the process can
be. We care about helping clients, we know we can change lives for the better,
and we never back down from a fight. **No matter what.**

##  No Matter **How Tough the Fight**

Insurance companies have mastered their tactics. They delay a claim in the
hopes that a person will be frustrated into settling for less than they
deserve. In the worst instances, they deny valid claims because they’re hoping
a claimant won’t contest it. These strategies have created a business model
that’s frustrating for claimants but profitable for insurance companies. It’s
our duty to fight against these unethical strategies for clients, no matter
how much the insurance company tries to overwhelm us.

Hiring Arnold & Itkin means telling your insurance company that their tactics
won’t be tolerated. We investigate claims, hire our own experts, and bring the
fight to them. We get results by caring about our clients. When we learn about
what our clients have gone through before calling us, the fight becomes
personal. Insurance companies are massive, and no one deserves to face their
bad faith practices on their own.

 **Having our firm take your case means it’ll have the care, resources, and
attention that’s only possible from a law firm that’s recovered billions for
clients.**

##  No Matter **Who You Ask**

We've consistently received the legal industry's **highest honors** , won the
nation's largest results, and been repeatedly featured in both local and
national news publications. We're proud of these honors and deeply grateful to
the clients who continually put their trust in our team.

##  Common **Questions**

  * ### What If My Insurance Company Is Delaying or Denying My Claim?

If your insurance is delaying or denying a claim they should be honoring, they
might be acting in bad faith. Insurance companies purposefully delay or deny
valid claims because they stand to profit more the longer a claim takes.
Additionally, insurers hope that making the claims process frustrating will
push a person to accept less than they’re owed. We're ready to be the advocate
you need by leveling the playing field and letting your insurance company know
that their tactics won’t work on your claim.

  * ### Do Insurance Companies Have a Time Limit for Responding?

Yes, an insurance company has two weeks from the time a claim is made to
respond to it. If they take longer than two weeks to respond to a claim,
they’re acting in bad faith to the claimant. After responding to a claim,
insurers are obligated to provide timely and reasonable updates. If you think
that your insurer is taking too long to honor your claim, it’s time to call
our team. Our insurance claim lawyers can advocate for your recovery and let
your insurance company know that their tricks are unacceptable.

  * ### Should I Accept an Initial Offer from an Insurance Company?

Accepting an initial offer might be a mistake. Often, insurance companies try
to look like they’re doing the right thing by quickly offering compensation.
Their hope is to get a person to accept less than they deserve and lose the
ability to obtain additional compensation. Our insurance lawyers can look at
your offer, investigate your claim independently, and hold your company to the
compensation that you really deserve.

  * ### Should I Negotiate with the Insurance Company on My Own?

It is generally not advisable to negotiate with the insurance company on your
own before seeking legal representation. Insurance companies, skilled at
protecting their own interests, may attempt to minimize your claim or offer a
settlement less than the amount to which you are entitled. By consulting with
our experienced insurance claim lawyers, we can help you navigate the complex
process, advocate for your rights, and ensure that you receive fair and just
compensation for your claim.
